alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna; Luzerne; Pike; Wayne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 18 at 8:48AM EST until December 18 at 2:45PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Lackawanna County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Central Luzerne County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Northwestern Pike County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Southwestern Wayne County in northeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 245 PM EST. * At 848 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Scranton, Hazleton, Muhlenberg, Dunmore, Archbald, Olyphant, West Hazleton, Paupack, Freeland, Bear Creek, Moscow, Conyngham, Nescopeck, Sterling, Hawley, Slocum, White Haven, Elmhurst, Shickshinny and Lehigh. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
